textContent:
Combat healing is scarce and strategic. To compensate, most enemies are not bursty. Think of Warcraft 3, FFVII, etc. Anyone can pick up healing, but if you want to become a reliable healer you must specialize a LOT into it, and still, you will be worse than a regular, blizzlike healer. Instead, there are a lot more support abilities. Healing abilities also have a high CD. 
Absorb shields are a bit more prevalent, specially smaller shields and magic school specific shields. Stronger shields may also decay over time.

OOC Health Regeneration is very slow, but you can build your character to improve it. Think of Victory Strike, improved regeneration like trolls, etc.

Items can boost your healing dramatically, but at the cost of their slot. You can equip a necklace that increases your healing by 50% on targets below 25% HP, but at the cost of missing out on necklaces that give you unique passives, synergies, etc.

Some healing/absorbtion abilities:
- Healing Circle: Heals everyone in your party for 2000. Instant, 30 second CD, costs energy.
- Mending Sigil: You place a Sigil on your target that will heal them for 2% of their health for every hit they receive, up to 20 hits or until its duration ends. Lasts for 20 seconds.
